intro: Octomeria candidae, commonly known as the white-flowered octomeria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Octomeria candidae is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
